intro: Tanacetum achilleae, commonly known as the Achillea's tanacetum, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has a historical association with the myth of Achilles. Tanacetum achilleae is also valued for its medicinal properties, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of the genus.
